reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I recently returned from a two week stay at the Sol Don Pedro. Our balcony was surrounded by beautiful landscaping that permiated the entire property. We seldom used the sun cots by the pool. We preferred liesurely lunches on the balcony with a bottle of cheap wine.
reviews.title: Beautiful grounds, very clean, good food, excellant value....
Not bad!
reviews.text: We had a board arrangement. The selection of food was good. It was a buffet the selection was appealing if you like fish{we do}. Unfortunately being a buffet the meals tended to be rushed. All of the members of our group were pleasantly surprised at the quality of the hotel.
The only general criticism was that the rooms were small.
reviews.title: Family with young Child

reviews.text: I booked this hotel for a cheap 2nd holiday, and although I wouldn't rave about it I wasn't disappointed.
reviews.title: overpriced, over-rated, forget it
early holiday
reviews.text: The hotel is spotlessly clean & the maids came every day, bedding was changed twice in the week & the towels every day.
Seven of us have just returned from a two night break. We thought the
reviews.title: Excellent for the money!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: hotel was excellent and will definetly go back again.
reviews.title: good hotel, great value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2005, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: went to Don Pedro for a weekend break from Glasgow. Booked flights and hotel from Globespan. Like most of the hotels they use Don Pedro was great value for what we paid. Booking in was hassle free; we were a bit worried about a sign saying we should check in after 14:00. No problem, we turned up at 11:00 and were in our room in minutes. Dont use a coach transfer to this resort if you can avoid it. Its only a few minutes in a taxi and it saves an hour or two going up and down making 15 drops. The taxi fare was only 16Euro each way. The hotel is comfortable and very clean, even by SOL standards which are usually very good any way. It is only 4 floors high, and is a plain building but some clever landscaping and mature gardens work wonders on the outside. Didnt use the pools, but they looked ok. Cant say how they would be at peak times. Food was usual hotel buffet, but was a bit better than most. Well the salad was fresh and everything wasnt full of fish, and for a veggie thats about as good as it gets in hotels. Outside Torrimolinos was busy, mainly with spanish tourists enjoying the beach and the dozens of seafood/tapas places that are all along the front. Sunday afternoon they were all packed. So its not your usual chips with everything place. If you feel like a walk head all the way along the front towards Benalmadena or go up the winding stairs, lined with shops, bars etc to the town centre( there is a lift for 50 cents, but no view) Overall it was a good weekend
reviews.title: **Fab Hotel**

reviews.text: We stayed here in August 2005 after recommendations from friends. The hotel is part of 3 hotels, (Don Pablo and Marco) this one being the 3* the others are 4. The hotel is at first sight very Spanish, low beams, cheap plants etc but the staff at the entrance were good and practically bilingual. We were at first given a room on the top floor which only has a handful of rooms and no lift or balcony, we went back to complain expecting a fuss but were given a different room immediately. The rooms are fairly basic but comfortable, we didnt spend a great deal of time there, the hotel had lovely public areas however. There was often a queue to get into the restaurant after an hour or so so its best to get down early. The food itself was great, there is a wide selection and something for everyone. there is also a lovely italian buffet at the back where u can get spag bol, pizza or pasta every night,i was told none of the other hotels have this facility. Now for the facilities, as it is a sister hotel i can only rave about them you were given the choice of 3 sets of pools, jacuzzi's and cafe's. I think if you stay in the Pablo or Marco you are able to eat in any hotel too. We loved the hotel's own pool as it catches the sun. We were usually found at a wee nook we found which doesnt allow children it was round from our pool but i think it was next to Pablo's. The nightlife is ok, not really made for young groups but nice for families and couples. this is also the first place iv visited with a proper town, if you go along the street (to the right through the beach side) and walk along you will find a lift and set of stairs, go up here walk along and then turn right you'll find a huge town with 100's of shops. Plenty of activities to do which we booked with hotel. You will love the facilities this hotel has to offer! We will definetely go back! Enjoy your holiday!
reviews.title: Honeymoon in the middle of construction work ??
Excellent hotel, well recommended.
reviews.text: We didn't accept the room in Hotel Don Pedro.

I think this is the 4th or 5th time that I have stayed at the Sol Don Pedro over the past 6 years. I return mainly for the location - excellent location on the seafront at Bajondillo beach. If travelling by taxi from Malaga airport it takes approx 15 mins and costs approx 16 euros one way.
reviews.title: spring break

likes.liked: — 4th or 5th visit - so its obviously doing something right!
likes.disliked: — internet - 1 euro for 15 mins! pricey! find an internet cafe

reviews.title: Excellent break
reviews.text: Its worth giving an update on the hotel - as the previous stay was 2006.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As mentioned in previous write ups the hotel is part of the complex with the Don Marco and Don Pablo. Facilities of all three hotels are available whichever you stay in. The hotel seems to have an ongoing maintenance program which keeps everything looking fairy decent.
reviews.title: Clean and friendly but confusing.

likes.disliked: — It was small and a long way from reception

reviews.text: The restaurant is still busy offering the 'showcase' chef cooking. The queues for this can be quite long! Other buffet options are generous with choice. 'Hot food' can often be tepid. Perhaps they would be better doing a carvery?
reviews.title: Brilliant!

likes.liked: — The whole atmosphere and the food

reviews.text: The rooms do tend to be on the small side but comfortable and generally quiet. Superior rooms are located overlooking the main pool towards the sea front. Other rooms tend to overlook other parts of the hotel eg. car park, 2nd pool, tennis court etc. I would question the value of paying for a superior room just to get the 'sunny side'.
reviews.title: Great Hotel Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Sol Don Pedro is a pleasant, well located hotel which is set back from the promenade on the Bajondillo side of Torremolinos.
reviews.title: Well located hotel

reviews.text: We stayed in a 'superior' room on the top (fourth) floor of the hotel. This description as 'superior' should not be mistaken for being anything special - it only offers what would be expected in any ordinary hotel. The room looked out onto the pool, across to the Sol Don Pablo and had a partial sea view. There was plenty of activity going on all around to stop you being bored when sitting on the balcony. The room and the hotel were kept spotlessly clean. Air conditioning in the room was very effective. The only down side of the room was the very small balcony, which was a bit of a squeeze. We were out and about for most of the time and did not take full advantage of the facilities on offer so cannot comment fully on what is available. This is why we are giving it a neutral score. All staff we encountered were professional, efficient and obliging. The hotel is well situated for all the amenities of Torremolinos. We would recommend taking the 'superior ' room option if available since we wonder what a less than superior room would offer?? We found two excellent places to eat - try the Cafe/Bistro Europa (Pasaje del Bajondillo) - good service and lovely food - the stuffed red pepper option and the sea bass option were superb - this is next door but one to Sheerins - a pleasant Irish Bar. On the Carihuela Beach side of town try the Cosy Nook restaurant (on the seafront, just at the start of the row of bars/cafes on the prom when you have walked round the headland from Bajondillo. ) The Cosy Nook has pleasant staff, good plain reasonably priced food and best of all - REAL CHIPS!!!!! Good bars to visit - Sheerins, El Bar de Ana and the Ship Inn (brilliant for people watching if you can get a table outside). These three bars are within a few hundred yards of each other. We would stay at the Don Pedro again.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: Just returned from a seven night stay at the Hotel Sol Don Pedro in Torremolinos, Malaga.I went with my husband and two kids aged 16 and 11.We all had a very good time not wanting to come back home.
reviews.title: Great spot - central and great for kids!

likes.liked: — It's location - the pools wer numerous and the beach a two minute walk away. Good food.
likes.disliked: — The size of the room - too small for three but fine for 2.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Reception staff were so nice and helpful.
reviews.title: Excellent last minute lazy break

likes.liked: — Friendliness of both staff and other guests.
likes.disliked: — Can't really say. Everything was good value for what we paid.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Animation team was absolutely great.They were friendly , funny and very helpful.You can join in games like rifle shooting , archery etc.There is also a gym if you want to keep fit free of charge and two jacuzzis if you want to relax.
reviews.title: Claire and Brian june 08
